fields.desc:
[{"type": "Description", "value": "

In order to build a more intimate and personal relationship with the sector we serve and to holistically form our members, Ateneo SPEED conducts weekly area visits to our partner institutions.

", "id": "ed6c5bef-868a-4504-b29b-37664fbefc7e"}]

fields.name: Laro, Lapis at Libro
fields.description: Laro, Lapis at Libro (LLL) is a special education school located in St. Mountainview Village, Marikina for kinder to grade 6 students. Two tracks are offered; a functional track primarily for life skills, and an academic track which follows the traditional curriculum and subjects. LLL is a loving community, where every area visit will surely make you smile!

fields.name: Eucharistiana Center
fields.description: Eucharistiana Center (EC) is a special education center in Marikina founded by Peter Malinggona. The school caters to students with Down Syndrome, Autism, and Intellectual Disability by teaching them both basic and vocational skills.

fields.name: Precious Gem Academy
fields.description: Precious Gem Academy (PGA) is an inclusive school that offers Grades 1-10 with a progressive and traditional K-12 curriculum. They have a number of students with and without special needs, with one section per year level. They also offer pre-vocational education for older students to prepare them for employment.

fields.name: St. Francis VSA Arts
fields.description: St. Francis VSA Arts (SF) is a school that provides education and therapy. While mostly for children who are hard of hearing, the school also has students that have other disabilities and some with none. The principal, Ma’am Becky, has over 25 years of experience with the sector and the school’s therapy is centered around art. These artworks are also sold by the students in weekend bazaars for the end goal of independence and self-sufficiency.

fields.name: Servants of Charity
fields.description: Servants of Charity (SOC) or Guanella Center is a privately run school and shelter for people with disabilities. The all-male in-house PWSNs they cater to primarily have Autism, Cerebral Palsy, Intellectual Disability, and Down Syndrome. All in all, SOC has 20 in-house PWSNs and was founded in 2010 to accommodate those who need full-time care.

fields.name: Sacred Heart Center
fields.description: Sacred Heart Center (SH) is a school which was established in 2008 and is currently located in West Fairview, Quezon City. It primarily caters to students with special needs such as Down Syndrome, Cerebral Palsy, ADHD, Autism, and the like. Furthermore, SH provides their students with an avenue to grow and develop their cognitive, verbal, and motor skills through quality education and therapy.

fields.name: Ateneo de Manila
fields.description: As an organization that is geared towards building an inclusive society, we empower the special needs sector by collaborating with organizations and holistically forming our members as advocates of the special needs sector.

fields.name: UP Diliman
fields.description: As an organization that is geared towards building an inclusive society, we empower the special needs sector by collaborating with organizations and holistically forming our members as advocates of the special needs sector.
